result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andres J Romero-Santiago

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andres J Romero-Santiago appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Andres J Romero-Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Fred Svensson. 
Defendant has not completed any of the terms of the agreement as of today's court date. In order to receive the benefits of the agreement, the defendant needs to complete the terms of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Liesel Monroy

Defendant Andres J Romero-Santiago in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case rescheduled off the record due to court congestion.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Andres J Romero-Santiago in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andres J Romero-Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional time to complete a TADD evaluation and requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Andres J Romero-Santiago in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. 
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.

ADDRESS INFO for Andres J Romero-Santiago
Current: 423 N Church Street, Watertown, WI 53098   (Effective: 04-29-2022)
Prior: 1323 South 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Sworn as interpreter: Remi Bashi  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/29/22 @ 1p
